channel.title: Little problem
channel.description:
ok so this is what happens..
i have my server up on my computer ok. i go to my dads to play but when i log in on my dads computer for some reason all the connection ips are the ip of my dads computer. and it cuases it to crash, restarting my router fixes this problem but thats only if i dont log back in on my dads computer..
heres a little example of what im saying..
[code] Voule Auto restart Restarting server Starting pures scape v1 Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:1728 Client type: low memory version UserId: 82128902 gunnie is signing onto server. [client-1-gunnie]: playerCommand: empty ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:26237 Client type: low memory version UserId: 82128902 sh4t 0n is signing onto server. [client-1-gunnie]: Auto saved game. [client-1-gunnie]: Auto saving moreinfo file... [client-1-gunnie]: Successfuly auto saved moreinfo file. ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:50667 Client type: low memory version UserId: 82128902 smite m3 is signing onto server. [client-2-sh4t 0n]: playerCommand: players ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:50668 [/code]
[code] ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26242 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26243 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26244 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26245 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26246 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26248 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26249 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26250 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26251 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26252 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26253 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26254 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26255 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26256 ClientHandler: Rejected from 69.92.144.193:26257 [/code]
if you could help id be verry thankfull

item.title: Little problem
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

ok if i log in using same computer as server there ips stay same… but when i log in on my dads computer all the connecting ips is the ip of my dads computer

Voule Auto restart
Restarting server
Starting pures scape v1 Server on 0.0.0.0:43594
ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:1728
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 82128902
gunnie is signing onto server.
[client-1-gunnie]: playerCommand: empty
ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:26237
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 82128902
sh4t 0n is signing onto server.
[client-1-gunnie]: Auto saved game.
[client-1-gunnie]: Auto saving moreinfo file…
[client-1-gunnie]: Successfuly auto saved moreinfo file.
ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:50667
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 82128902
smite m3 is signing onto server.
[client-2-sh4t 0n]: playerCommand: players
ClientHandler: Accepted from 69.92.144.193:50668

see there all the same ip…[br][size=1]Posted on: October 29, 2007, 11:41:16 AM[/size][hr]sorry for double post but help me =\

Read full topic

item.title: Little problem
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

yes but how do i make it where they still have there own ips instead of using my dads when i login on his computer

Read full topic

item.title: Little problem
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“squal707, post:5, topic:155390”]so the 1 you put is fixed or the problem…

nvm i see it there aligned different[/quote]

No thats not fixed… Look at the code.

				 if(!BanManager.BannedAddress(connectingAddress)) // Is ip banned?
				 {
				  misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingAddress+":"+s.getPort());
					 playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingAddress);
				 }
				 else
				 {
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected from "+connectingAddress+":"+s.getPort());
				   s.close(); // Ip is banned, lets simply refuse the connection - Kevin - Rune-Server.org
				 }
				}
			}

Thats saying, if the ip, isn’t in BanManager, it accepts the host.

If anything ELSE
It rejects the host.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Little problem
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

				 if(!BanManager.BannedAddress(connectingAddress)) // Is ip banned?

Check if they’re ip banned first.

EDIT: Yea i think thats it…

				  misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingAddress+":"+s.getPort());
					 playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingAddress);
				 }
				 else
				 {
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected from "+connectingAddress+":"+s.getPort());
				   s.close(); // Ip is banned, lets simply refuse the connection - Kevin - Rune-Server.org
				 }
				}

Read full topic

item.description:

mind checking it out for me

item.title: Little problem
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Did you add anti SYI, or anti crasher? If so, you’ve done it wrong… It shouldn’t ban regular users, for logging / mass logging. To fix this, you would need to edit the run method, in server.java.

Read full topic
